input: Write a formal outreach email to Prof. Anil Sharma at IIT Roorkee requesting a research internship in quantum optics. Mention the candidate's background in quantum mechanics and signal interest in his 2023 paper on optical lattices.
output:
Dear Professor Sharma,

I hope you are doing well. My name is Abhijeet Kumar, a third-year undergraduate at IIT Roorkee majoring in Physics and Computer Programming. I recently read your 2023 paper on optical lattices and was fascinated by the experimental techniques used to control atom trapping. My coursework and project work include advanced quantum mechanics, Schrödinger equation analysis, and numerical simulations of 1D tunneling problems. I would be honored to contribute to your group as a research intern and assist with simulations or experimental data analysis. If possible, may I request a short meeting to discuss potential opportunities and the skills I could bring to your lab?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Abhijeet Kumar
IIT Roorkee

input: Write a brief, polite follow-up email to a professor after no reply for two weeks. The candidate previously introduced themselves and requested a meeting.
output:
Dear Professor,

I hope you are well. I wanted to follow up on my previous message regarding potential research opportunities in your group. I remain very interested in learning more about your work and how I might contribute. If you are available, I would be grateful for a brief meeting at your convenience. Thank you again for your time.

Best regards,
Abhijeet Kumar

input: Write an email to a professor asking for feedback on a research proposal draft. Include a one-sentence summary of the proposal and ask whether the advisor has time to review.
output:
Dear Professor,

I hope this note finds you well. I have attached a one-page draft of a research proposal exploring the use of variational methods to model electron transport in 2D materials. In one sentence, the proposal aims to develop a computational pipeline to estimate conductivity as a function of defect density. Would you be willing to review the draft and provide brief feedback? I would be grateful for any guidance or suggestions.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Abhijeet Kumar

input: Write a polite email to a professor requesting permission to join a lab meeting as an interested applicant. Mention relevant course project experience.

input: Write an email that summarizes a professor's recent abstract (two sentences) and connects it to the student's skills. The professor wrote about Landau levels in graphene.
output:
Dear Professor,

I read your recent abstract on Landau level splitting in graphene, where you report an unexpected degeneracy lifting at high magnetic fields. My background includes analytical solutions of 2D electron gases and numeric simulations of Landau quantization; I believe I could help extend the numerical modeling to explore parameter regimes discussed in your paper. I would appreciate an opportunity to discuss this further.

Sincerely,
Abhijeet Kumar

input: Write an outreach email asking for co-advising on an interdisciplinary project between physics and CS.

I can provide a project summary and timeline at your convenience.

Thank you for your time.

Best regards,
Abhijeet Kumar

Sincerely,
